title: What's the best voip phone system? - Quora

response.answer_text: it depends on your budget and your business requirement.a system that will be best for person A can not definitely be good for person B.in the VoIP phone system market, there are numerous providers who provide numerous solutions to address different kinds of user requirementssome VoIP phone system is best for startups who have less user requirement some are specifically designed for enterprise who have more than 100 users.if you want to use a VoIP for your personal use then you can use skype for business or WhatApps for business but it will hamper your credibility as I think and I have experienced that this type of solution is a little unprofessional.the good one according to me is Grasshopper, RingCentral, Nextiva, etc.the best one will be CallHippo VoIP service as they provide value for money service. most importantly they have plans which can address all type of use requirement from a startup to an enterprise they have services and custom plans for all type of users.

1 CallHippo CallHippo is one of the most popular virtual phone systems around and helps you make high-quality calls. It includes standard features like call queuing, call transfer, conference calling, call forwarding, and more. This Business VoIP phone service has a simple web-based administration that makes it easy to manage calls, create new users, and a lot more. You can also integrate CallHippo with services you already use such as Slack, Zoho CRM, Zapier, Zendesk, and more to extend functionality. CallHippo Features: Create different departmentsCall barging lets supervisors to take over a call when neededCall RecordingIVR SystemCustom MessagesLocal phone numbers available in 50+ countriesHold musicEmail SupportPriority EmailFree Calling CreditsCall from Any NumberRing All DevicesOffice/Number Opening Hours2. Nextiva Nextiva is the best business VoIP system available and offers an easy-to-use, powerful system. Moreover, you don’t need an annual contract and Nextiva is quick to setup. This VoIP provider comes with a ton of super cool features like unlimited calling, auto attendant, advanced call management, voicemail to email and text, and more. In addition, you’ll get a toll-free number free with any of their plans. Nextiva Features: Quick setupUnlimited calling to the United States, Canada, and Puerto RicoBring your current phone numbers (number portability)3. Grasshopper Grasshopper is a popular business phone system for small business owners. It comes with all the essential features you need like call transfers, incoming call control, simultaneous call handling, custom greetings, voicemail, and more. For outgoing calls, you can use Grasshopper’s mobile or desktop apps and there’s no restriction on the number of minutes you can use. Both the web-based portal and app-based portal are easy to use, but some users report that the mobile apps (particularly the iPhone app) are unreliable. Grasshopper Features: Desktop and mobile apps (iOS and Android) Voicemail transcription service Auto-attendant with custom greetings 4. RingCentral RingCentral is a reliable, secure, and hassle-free IP phone service. It’s easy to set up and comes with useful features like call forwarding, call monitoring, video and audio conferencing, automatic call recording, and screen sharing. Customer support from RingCentral seems to be a mixed bag; some users report receiving great customer service while others have complained about the poor customer service they’ve gotten. RingCentral Features: Simple and easy setup Unlimited calls within the United States and Canada Choose a toll-free or local number Unlimited audio and video conferencing 5. Vonage Vonage is a plug-and-play VoIP service that offers unlimited calling and SMS in the United States and Canada. Moreover, in addition to the standard VoIP features like voicemail to email, call screening, call forwarding, etc., you also get access to Amazon Chime. Unlike most of the providers on this list, Vonage offers toll-free numbers as an addon, meaning you have to pay more for it. However, Vonage does offer a ridiculously robust suite of features to choose from, so you can create the business phone system that’s perfect for you. Vonage Features: 99.999% uptime reliability Includes Amazon Chime Pro tier for chat, screen share, video, and web conferencing Mobile and desktop apps
